gov.nih.nlm.meme.xml
Class MASRequestSerializer

java.lang.Object
  org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler
      gov.nih.nlm.meme.xml.ObjectXMLSerializer
          gov.nih.nlm.meme.xml.MASRequestSerializer
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentHandler, DTDHandler, EntityResolver, ErrorHandler, XMLSerializer
public class MASRequestSerializer
extends ObjectXMLSerializer
implements XMLSerializer

Used to map MEME service request documents to MEMEServiceRequest objects and vice-versa using the public fromXML(String) or fromXML(Reader), and toXML(Object) methods. Internally, this class implements a validating SAX parser. Typically an instance must be informed of the location of the DTD via a call to setSystemId(String) method before one of the fromXML() methods is called. For example,

 String file = "my_file.xml";
 MEMERequestSerializer mrs = new MEMERequestSerializer();
 mrs.setSystemId("url of MASRequest.dtd");
 MEMEServiceRequest request = (MEMEServiceRequest)mrs.fromXML(file);
Alternatively the system id could be supplied to the serializer via the second constructor.

Author:
MEME Group

Method Detail

setSystemId

public void setSystemId(String url)
Sets the system id. This class implements a validating parser. When reading from a Reader, we need to know the SystemID so we can locate the DTD. This accessor method provides a hook to set the system id.

Parameters:
url - a String URL (for files use file:/ notation)

fromXML

public Object fromXML(String file)
               throws ReflectionException,
                      XMLParseException
Returns the object represented in the contents of the named XML file. This method takes a filename containing a MASRequest document, wraps a FileReader around it and passes it to fromXML(Reader,boolean) instructing it to use a validating parser.

Specified by:

Overrides:

characters

public void characters(char[] chars,
                       int start,
                       int length)
Handles characters between start and end tags. Remember, in a SAX parser, characters between tags may be buffered and so not sent all at once but in sections.

Specified by:
characters in interface ContentHandler
Overrides:
